skillTree.localised_description: A true Lord knows the Underway, his Dwarfhold and how to fight under the ground better than anyone.

skillTree.localised_description: This stubborn Dwarf refuses to yield or tire, and ensures his followers are of the same ilk.

skillTree.localised_description: All Dwarfs are stubborn, but none more so than Grudgebearer, the founder of the Age of Reckoning.

skillTree.localised_description: All Dwarfs despise the Greenskins, for the urki and grobi are the prime agents in the Times of Woe.

skillTree.localised_description: The endless courage of the Warrior God, directed to bolster this Dawiâ€™s own reserves.

skillTree.localised_description: Thunderhorn is carved from an ancient tusk said to have been brought by the Dwarfs from the distant south in ages past. It has been carried into battle by every Lord of Azul since Karak Azul was founded.

effects.description:
Control: +3
	(all provinces)
Character's aura leadership effect: +5
Leadership aura size: +50%
Ability: "Thunderhorn"

skillTree.localised_description: Karak Azul is a center for all kinds of metalworking. The trade value of their products in the human realms makes the craftsguilds of Karak Azul as economically important as the weaponsmiths.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +12% for Ironbreakers and Miners units
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs. Infantry: +8 for Ironbreakers and Miners units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Ironbreakers and Miners units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The King has promised half his treasure hoard to the Dwarf who brings his kinsfolk back alive; a quarter of it to anyone who brings their dead bodies back to rest in Karak Azul. To anyone who kills Gorfang he has promised the pick of his treasures.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 10% when fighting against Greenskins and Skaven
	(Lord's army)

Passive ability: "Deathblow" when fighting against Greenskins and Skaven
	(Lord's army)

Income from sacking Greenskin and Skaven settlements: +50%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: King Kazador has become a dark and brooding avenger, a pursuer of his people's enemies, and callous destroyer of evil wherever he finds it. As he leads his armies into battle, he sounds the great Thunderhorn to proclaim that King Kazador has come to take his vengeance once more.

effects.description: Melee defence: +6
Weapon strength: +15%
Missile strength: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: While their King sits on his throne, the forges of Karak Azul have continued to produce weapons of unrivalled quality. Traded along the Underway and through hidden mountain trails, weapons from Karak Azul are in great demand throughout Dwarfholds and settlements.

effects.description: Construction time: -1 for resource-producing buildings
Construction cost: -30% for resource-producing buildings

Tradable resources produced: +10%
	(factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: In his younger days, Kazador enjoyed life to the full, entertaining his subjects by performing feats of strength such as lifting a pack mule loaded with gold, drinking his greatest warriors under the table, and - his favourite sport of all - hunting greenskins in the mountains, perhaps with Gorfang gone these days could come back..

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 when fighting against Greenskins and Skaven
	(all units in army)

Attribute: Causes Terror when fighting against Greenskins
Attribute: Causes Terror when fighting against Skaven

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

effects.description: Ability: "Foe-Seeker"

skillTree.localised_description: Dwarfs are resolute - once they commit to charging the foe, they put all their strength behind that initial blow.

factionEffects.localised_description: The only thing that lightens King Kazador's gloom is being able to settle old scores and to this end he has led armies all over the Worlds Edge Mountains. He has become a dark and brooding avenger, a pursuer of his people's enemies, and callous destroyer of evil wherever he finds it. As he leads his armies into battle, he sounds the great Thunderhorn to proclaim that King Kazador has come to take his vengeance once more. Perhaps he hopes that one day he will meet Gorfang in battle, so that at last he can avenge himself of his enemy and lift the burden of responsibility that lies upon his heart.

effects.description:
Attribute: Wallbreaker for Miners units
	(all armies)

Income from Iron Mines, Gold Mines and Stone Quarries: +100%
	(factionwide)

Income from Toolmakers: -50%
	(factionwide)

items.onscreen_name: Armour of the King of Karak Azul
items.colour_text: This armour was forged in ancient days and is worn by the King of Karak Azul whenever he marches to war. It is forged from the finest gromril.

effects.description: Enemy Hero action success chance: -10%
Melee defence: +5
Missile resistance: 10%
Passive ability: "Armour of the King of Karak Azul"

unit_ability.onscreen_name: Armour of the King of Karak Azul

items.colour_text: The Hammer of Karak Azul has been borne by the royal line of Azul since the time of Grungni, and it can only be lifted by a member of Kazador's clan. This mighty two-handed warhammer is forged from gromril, and it bears an unusually potent combination of runes.

effects.description: Bonus vs Large: +8
Enables magical attacks
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +40
Ability: "Hammer of Karak Azul"

backgroundSkills.localised_description: King Kazador is the legendary King of Karak Azul, a magnificent and ancient Dwarf Hold that is situated with the southern lands of the Worlds Edge Mountains.
